title: CALL-Based Strategies to Facilitate Foreign Language Speaking Interaction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic computer literacy and foundational theories of language education
context.additional_context: Course emphasizing the acquisition of CALL (Computer-Assisted Language Learning) techniques applicable to real classrooms for preservice and in-service teachers.

learning_goals: Learners can explain methods for designing foreign language speaking interactions using diverse multimedia tools
Learners can produce improvement plans for CALL activities by applying interaction quality evaluation criteria per task type
Learners can develop at least two role-play scenarios utilizing Zoom-based real-time collaboration features
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
